data.title: MR. ALEXANDER GORDON
data.meta_description: The late Mr. Alexander Gordon, whose death was briefly reported in Friday's "Standard,'' was for 36 years a member of the Violet Town shire ...
data.text:
Council, and gave valuable service to

the ratepayers. He wa© elected in

August, 1901, taking the place of the

late C. Underwood. He resigned in

August 1937, and was succeeded by

Or. T. P. Underwood. He was pre

sident on eight occasions. He was

a trustee of the Violet Town District

Cemetery Trust, and for many years

cnairman of that body. He was a

Justice of the Peace, and for many

years an Elder of the Presbyterian

Church. He was horn at Campbe'Il-

field (Victoria),, and was a son of

the late Mr. and Mrs. Neil K. Gor

don, who were among the earliest

of the Balmattum pioneers, and spent

practcially the whole of his 'life in

that district, until Some years ago

he took up residence in Violet' Town.

He was keenly interested in al'l pub

lic matters, and as an active mem

ber of many bodies played hi© full

part in the development of the dis

trict. Despite his advanced age, his

hardy nature refused to allow him to

remain inactive, and though of re

cent years he suffered several ill

nesses and sustained injury in a

couple of accidents, he remained an

active worker practically to the time

of his death. His passing is regret,

ted by a very wide circle of friends

throughout the Violet Town and

Euroa districts. Ili© wife predeceas

ed him many years ago, and he is

survived by three sons, Neil (Vic

torian Railways, Alelbourne), Alex

(Violet Town), William, (National

Bank, Abbottsford), and one daugh

ter, Ethel (Airs. J. Crilly, Warren-

bayne), who have the sympathy of

their many friends in their bereave

ment.

The funeral wa© attended by a

very large and representative gather

ing of friends from the Euroa and

Violet Town districts, and many who

travelled long distances, paid the last

tribute of respect to an esteemed

citizen. The burial service was con

ducted by the Rev. Air. Brennan (Eu

roa), assisted by the. Revs. F. Parker

(Violet Town) and Robertson, the

latter having been a former Presby

terian minister at Euroa, and a great

friend of the late Air. Gordon more

than forty years ago. The coffin

was carried by Messrs K. Gordon, G.

ALKernan, G. Wakenshaw, A. Lane,

W. Smith and H. Hooper (nephews

of deceased) ; and the pall'-bearers

were Alessrs J. Gordon (brother), J.

Gordon (cousin), J. Crilly (son-in-law)

W. Ramage ('Cemetery trustee), Geo.

Forshaw (Violet Town Shire Coun

cil), and T. King. A large number

of floral tributes was received, in

cluding wreaths from the Violet

Town Shire Council, Violet Towm

Cemetery trustees, Violet Town sub-

branch R.S.S.I.L.A,., the Balmattum

Presbyterian Church, and the Trans

portation Branch of the Victorian

Raifways.

The mourners included the only

surviving brother of deceased, Mr.

James Gordon, and two sisters, Alias

Gordon, Nagambie and Airs. Lane, of

Narandera.
